episodes.synopsis: In the nation's early days, men drink cider and beer at nearly every occasion. But whiskey becomes affordable and more drunks head into the gutter.
episodes.title: A Nation of Drunkards

episodes.synopsis: On Jan. 16, 1920, the 18th Amendment to the Constitution goes into effect, making it illegal to manufacture, transport or sell intoxicating liquor.
episodes.title: A Nation of Scofflaws

episodes.synopsis: As the Jazz Age rallies on, buoyed by an unprecedented winning streak on Wall Street, it seems the party will never end despite Prohibition.
episodes.title: A Nation of Hypocrites

video.title: Ken Burns: Prohibition
video.synopsis: Ken Burns's documentary traces the passage of the 18th Amendment, the social and legal effects of prohibiting alcohol, and the repeal of Prohibition.
